name: Holiday Inn Darling Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights from the 21st November and were very happy with it. We had only managed to book a smoking room but when we asked to change to non-smoking the staff were very helpful and took a lot of time to try to change our room. In the end, I think we got an upgrade as the room was pretty spacious and was on the top floor. We didn't hear any noise from the monorail but did have the airconditioning on so that may have masked the noise. The bathroom was a bit compact and the bed was far too soft, but for AUD$140 a night, we were pretty happy.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful. We arrived at midnight having not eaten dinner and they recommended a busy little restaurant to us in chinatown, literally a minute's walk away. As it turned out, we ate there many times during our stay, even for brekafast! It was cheap and cheerful and had excellent food, but maybe not everyone's taste of course. The staff also provided us with a universal adaptor as we had accidentally left ours in the last hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: I'm not sure how easy it is to get to Circular Quay by public transport as we walked everywhere, but it was certainly no distance to Darling Harbour.
reviews.title: Not bad but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in April 2006 and found it to be a convenient location, good value, clean, comfortable hotel. I would probably class the location as China town, not Darling Harbour but it's only about a 5 min walk to all the bars and restaurants of Darling Harbour and the monorail station is practically right outside to get you around the city. For the money, I would deffinately reccomend this hotel, the service was good, our safe didn't work when we arrived but they sent someone immediately to fix it. Sydney is now one of my favourite citys in the world and I would stay here again without a doubt.
reviews.title: All round good hotel...
Location, Location, Location !!!!!
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day stay. Hotel is centrally located, with most major attractions within reasonable walking distance. Having the Sydney Explorer bus stop across the road was a bonus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: The rooms were of a good size and were clean and the beds comfortable. We paid $171/ night including buffet breakfast for 2 people.
reviews.title: Ordinary hotel
Great location, good hotel
reviews.text: Couple of minor crticism's, would have liked a change to the buffet breakfast selections. The only variety was they alternated daily between baked beans and spaghetti to go with the bacon,mushrooms, hash browns,tomatoes and scrambled eggs. The other annoyance was the noisy juice extractor people were using to make fresh fruit juices.

reviews.title: Perfect location in Sydney!
reviews.text: We ate a couple of times in JB'S bar and grill, the food was well cooked and reasonably priced. Not many people appeared to use the main restaurant in the evenings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights in mid December. The location is perfect; you are not more than 5 min by foot to Darling Harbour and all restaurants, and if you are not a lazy executive you can walk to circular quay.
reviews.title: Good Value
Dismal and smelly
reviews.text: This hotel is dismal ,smelly and noisy. The desk staff are hopeless.Don't stay here.

reviews.title: a very good hotel to explore sydney from
reviews.text: my wife and I and two relatives stayed two nites at the end of a cruise, our first time to Sydney - The Holiday Inn is well maintained and well managed and in a very good central location to explore all of Sydney ( Sydney is large enough and has seperate areas to explore that no hotel will be perfect for everywhere, but this is a good compromise ). Price was a fair value for the area, our only comment was the $25 asd per day for in room internet access is a bit steep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated in close proximity to both China Town and Darling Harbour with all of its restaurants, shopping & bars. There are also transport links nearby with the monorail, tram and train stations all located close to the hotel which can take you into town, circular quay or further afield.
reviews.title: Excellent base to explore Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean & functional but by no means luxurious. We had a high floor so were not bothered by the noise and i would recommend anybody booking the hotel requests to be higher up as there is a busy street & monorail line close to the lower rooms. The room was fine for a base to explore from with a comfy bed and reasonable bathroom, if you are looking for luxury then go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our week long stay at the hotel and would definately recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: A decent hotel in a convenient location, at the west end of Darling Harbour. We had a small suite on the 9th floor (an upgrade from the queen room we had reserved). The hallway carpets were disgustingly dirty, but the suite itself was fine, although unremarkable. As other reviewers have noted, the monorail runs right in front of the hotel, at the level of the second floor. We could barely hear it from our floor, so it wasn’t an issue for us, but I can imagine that it would be more of a nuisance lower down. The minibar fridge was turned off, so it and the drinks in it were warm, and the ice cube tray contained warm water. The only alternative for ice was to call room service, which wasn’t an appealing option.
reviews.title: Respectable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Centrally located about 10min walk to Darling Harbour/Central railway station and next to monorail station. Rooms were quite basic- this is not a 5 star hotel- but it was comfortable enough. As far as city accommodation goes it is reasonable value for money but if your looking for stylish accommodation look elsewhere. A cramped gym but had all the equipment needed in good condition - there was no pool but a small spa next to the gym ( entry through laundry)Didnt try the restaurant but bar next door served as a good starting ending point for the evening.
reviews.title: value option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good sized, clean room. Opposite the monorail and entertainment centre (we were suprised to discover that Kylie was performing there during our stay). Short walk to Darling Harbour and next to China Town.We had a nice meal in the lounge bar but have to say that the decor was a little dated. In all,this was an ideal hotel for our needs - comfortable and central for touring.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my fiancee victoria went to australia to visit some of her familiy in a small town called Appin located in the suburbs of sydney which was excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we also stayed in the holiday inn at darling harbour in the heart of sydney for 2 nights staff and guests alike where very friendly. the rooms where a good size with a fully stocked min bar TV and king size bed.
reviews.title: Good, hotel, ok location.
Excellent discounted rooms
reviews.text: I've just stayed two nights in Darling Harbour with my 5yo son at the

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Holiday Inn on Harbour St, opposite the Entertainment Centre (which was therefore the view) and next to a monorail stop, the tram line and Paddy's Markets. It was amazingly quiet as the road directly outside seems to be a restricted access one with hardly any traffic. I booked the twin room through one of the websites that pop up when you google 'discount holidays sydney' or some such, and got it for $139 per night. This was a good price given the quality and standard of accommodation - lovely big, air conditioned room, comfortable beds, still new carpet, clean walls, Foxtel, gameboy facilities, internet; lovely bathroom with shower over bath and plenty of space. Complimentary everything ie shampoo and conditioner, shower cap etc, tea, coffee, milk - the only possible catch being the non-complimentary wine, orange juice, chocolates, muesli bars, crisps, soft drink etc which are also provided at exorbitant cost should you lack the discipline to resist them! Food at the in-house restaurants was also expensive to my mind although comparable with other classy restaurants in the area. We ate our own food for brekky and packed lunch, and ate elsewhere the 1st night. On the 2nd night I found I was able to get a decent room service meal for both of us by ordering
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from the kids menu - we had battered fish with steamed vegies, fruit salad & ice cream, about $18 and the single serves were easily big enough for both of us. Service at this hotel was impeccable and security is excellent as everything operates on cards. We were able to go from our hotel room to the Aquarium and other attractions without folding up our stroller! So if you're traveling with a young child or if you are yourself reliant on wheels through a disability, this is an excellent place to stay. If you're travelling on the cheap, treat yourself by searching 6 or 7 days ahead and booking the less popular, discounted nights. Our room went up to $199 if we'd wanted to stay a 3rd night.
reviews.title: Clean, smart, pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights in the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour and considered it a good hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fair for the price. Helpful staff, clean rooms, good bar.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights here at the end of our trip to Australia. We were pleasantly surprised to receive a room on the top floor, which gave us a nice view of the city, and was on the side of the building so we didn't have to worry about the noise of the tram. The room was what you would expect of a Holiday Inn, with one bed, a chair, a desk, refrigerator, etc. The air conditioning would only work if you put your key in a slot near the controls, which I assume is to save energy. The room was clean and the service was good. The only complaint I had was that they are renovating the elevators and only one seemed to be working consistently. The other would stop at every floor, whether you pushed the button or not, which is not fun in an already overcrowded elevator travelling through 11 floors. It is a 5 min walk to darling harbour and the ferry, and across from a market place. We took a cab to the opera one night and it was about $13 AUD. If you want to be close to Circular Qauy and the Opera House, then you may want to look elsewhere. We generally walked from the hotel to the Quay and it took 15 to 20 mins, but was pleasant. We would certainly consider staying here again if we were fortunate enough to revisit Australia.
reviews.title: Good hotel and locatiion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: We stayed at the holiday inn for 3 nights and found the hotel extremely good and great value for money. Its within a 5 minute walk to the darling harbour and just 10 mins from the main shopping district - George street. Despite this, the location is very peaceful. The monorail running along the hotel is no disturbance whatsoever and infact gives a better look to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help.
reviews.title: Very good - Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: The hotel staff really takes care of you as we recd a bottle of champagne the first night.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn. There was a mix-up with the room due to the booking agent giving us a twin room, but the hotel fixed this up immediately. Nice walk to Darling harbour. Convenient for the monorail, China Town and the Designer outlet stores :) at Paddy's market.
reviews.title: From Queensland Australia

likes.disliked: — Minor hiccup with teh booking- not the hotel's fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and helpful at all times.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Breakfast was good! Loved the Turkey bacon. Didn't find the juice extractor annoying like a previous reviewer, but the coffee service was a bit slow at times. The gym facilities on the 3rd floor were good, and included a spa, steam room and sauna.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You've got to be quick on the draw with your keycard in the lift. If not, you might end up getting there via the top floor.
reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With The Holiday Inn, Darling Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Try the Asian foodhalls around behind the hotel. They were great and inexpensive.
reviews.title: Good hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour to be a bargain compared to other hotels in Sydney.
reviews.title: Fantastic Bang For the Buck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Factor in the friendly staff and good location with a very reasonable price and you have a smart selection for the budget traveller (but not too budget!).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lots of tourist sites, a plethora of restaurants and shopping areas within walking distance from this hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location and Price for Sydney

likes.disliked: — The monorail on the outside of the building...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a solid choice for those who don’t need a four-star accommodation, but still want a well-kept, comfortable and centrally-located hotel.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour in November and enjoyed our stay. Both the check in and check out process was quick and easily handled by staff that were friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was a good size for the rate we paid, was exceptionally clean and had everything you could need. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar which also very nice. We could hear the monorail a little bit at night, but it certainly wasn’t enough to disturb neither my wife nor I from getting a good night’s sleep.
reviews.title: 4 OUT OF 5

description: Emanating a quiet charm right in the middle of the action, Holiday Inn Darling Harbour has the best that Sydney has to offer on its doorstep. A heritage listed former Wool Store cloaks the northern wing of the hotel in history. Situated in the Southern end of Sydney's central business district, the hotel is ideally positioned to allow you to make the most of your visit to Sydney. Take a leisurely stroll through Darling Harbour with its many attractions. The vibrant Chinatown and Latin Quarter are close by and the Sydney Entertainment Centre right across the road. You can walk to some of Sydney's best restaurants, theatres and shopping complexes. For something a little different, board a ferry, monorail or light rail for sightseeing. Trains and buses to Pitt Street Mall shopping precinct and Circular Quay are nearby too.
